title: Design for Textile
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
medium: Brush and ink, graphite on white tracing paper
description: Five separate groups of textile designs on one sheet; in graphite, upper left quadrant "pepitas" pattern; in ink and graphite at lower left, another version of "pepitas pattern. In ink and graphite at upper center, and again at upper right, "small triangles" pattern arranged in a rectangle. In ink and graphite at lower right, "plusses" pattern.
name: Drawing
